ISSUE.TITLE: GraphQL: Querying for Manufacturer on Inventory-Items leads to nun-null error
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Deployment Type Self-hosted ### NetBox Version v4.2.5 ### Python Version 3.10 ### Steps to Reproduce Reproducable on demo.netbox.dev. Also on v4.2.6 in our environment 1. Create a Inventory-Item on any device and leave the manufacturer blank (as it is not required 2. Query the following graph-ql (with the specific device-id): ``` query { device(id:172) {id name inventoryitems {id name manufacturer{id name}}} } ``` ### Expected Behavior Output of Device with given Inventory-Items and manufacturer to be null (i.e. like if tenant is not set): ``` { "data": { "device": { "id": "172", "name": "0634LEO", "inventoryitems": [ { "id": "1", "name": "Test", "manufacturer": null } ] } } } ``` ### Observed Behavior Error raised that manufacturer cannot be null: ``` { "data": null, "errors": [ { "message": "Cannot return null for non-nullable field InventoryItemType.manufacturer.", "locations": [ { "line": 2, "column": 68 } ], "path": [ "device", "inventoryitems", 0, "manufacturer" ] } ] } ```

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Added advanced object selector to custom field object and multi-object inputs (#18830)

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Fixes #18999: Allow GraphQL to represent inventory items with no set manufacturar
Fixes #18999: Allow GraphQL to represent inventory items with no set manufacturar (#19016)
